EducationEvent.teaches: Azure Logic Apps, Azure IoT Hub, EventGrid

about.description: With the use of IoT, device management and monitoring processes have become simpler. With serverless design patterns engineers can be alerted when devices go offline or when there is an anomaly in a measured value. In addition, no data is lost during an outage as all data is saved in cloud storage.
about.name: Get the most out of your IoT solutions with Serverless workloads

EducationEvent.assesses: Identity and Access Management Azure Services

about.description: In this lecture, I taught the basics of Azure Active Directory (Azure AD), Microsoft's cloud identity service. I showed how to create and manage users, groups and applications in Azure AD. By the end of the lecture, participants had an overview of the benefits and challenges of using Azure AD to manage identity and access in the cloud.
about.name: First steps with Azure Active Directory

EducationEvent.teaches: Azure Open AI Service, AI assistants, integrated intelligence in the apps

about.description: A session talking about trends, challenges and best practices in artificial intelligence. Moreover, exploring the future of app development with AI assistants and integrated intelligence in the apps.
about.name: The Future of App Development with AI assistants and integrated intelligence

about.description: In this session I discussed the advantages and limitations of Azure Functions to create more scalable and less expensive solutions. I demonstrated the use cases and why you should migrate some of your existing applications to this schema.
about.name: Introduction to serverless compute with Azure Functions

EducationEvent.teaches: Azure Maps, Azure Static Web Apps

about.description: In this workshop we showed how to create a web application that allows you to map routes between different points using Azure Static Web Apps and Azure Maps services. We showed how to use Azure Maps APIs to obtain geographic information, calculate distances and times, and display interactive maps in your web application.
about.name: Web application for mapping routes with Azure Static Web Apps and Azure Maps

about.description: In this conference I taught how to use Infrastructure as Code (IaC) to create ephemeral and repeatable environments in the cloud, allowing you to automate the creation of resources and save Operational Expenditure.
about.name: Speed up app development and reduce OpEx with ephemeral and repeatable environments

about.description: In this talk I showed how easy and fast it is to create, manage, provision and destroy labs of several identical virtual machines using Azure Lab Services, with the software of your choice, so that students can do their homework or practice from home using the lab machines in a safe and secure way.
about.name: Creating virtual computer labs for your students with Azure

about.description: Azure Custom Vision allows you to create models which can classify and detect items in images. You could use this to detect a breed of dog, if someone is wearing a helmet, or the presence of other features. While this could be done by using code and manually processing the images, Custom Vision provides a web-based interface and tooling to streamline the process. No prior knowledge of machine learning or math is required!
about.name: Build a Machine Learning Model using Custom Vision

about.description: In this workshop, theory about the different approaches for machine learning models were discussed. Then, for a hands-on practice example, a predictive model was trained using AutoML and deployed to Azure Container Instances.
about.name: Azure Automated Machine Learning
